{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3440216,"name":"Antonio","username":"spaceZee","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/8c91f0/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-27T07:55:53.520Z","cooked":"

I am working on a configurable swerve module, but I am having issues with the configuration of the cover. I have controls to rotate and flip both motors individually. Currently, I can control all flipped motor variants of the top cover but not standard. I would like to leave all parts unsuppressed in the part studio if possible. Is there a way I’m overlooking to do this? Below is the document.

cad.onshape.com

Onshape

Sign in to Onshape, the #1 fastest growing CAD system in the world with over 4 million users.

  2. If I understand correctly, you can’t configure the top plat of the module in different orientations? Or do you mean switch between 2 different top plates (2 different parts)

I have created 25 different top covers that I would like to switch between depending on the selected motor orientation. I figured out a solution using a combination of 4 assemblies, but I am open to any cleaner implementation.

spaceZee:

Sorry, I’m new to sharing documents publicly. Hopefully this link works.

No problem, this works perfectly

spaceZee:

I have created 25 different top covers that I would like to switch between depending on the selected motor orientation. I figured out a solution using a combination of 4 assemblies, but I am open to any cleaner implementation.

I see, I think what you did is more than fine. Other people might know a better/more efficient way, but I’m not one of them
